    Introduction to ryx

    ryx.Rmd

    The ryx package’s main function is to visualize the specified correlation values from a dataset in a dataframe, summarized paragraph and a horizontal graph.

    library(ryx)
library(MASS)
x<- ryx(Boston, y="medv")
print(x)
#>    Variable      r        p sigif
#> 1     lstat -0.738  < 2e-16   ***
#> 2        rm  0.695  < 2e-16   ***
#> 3   ptratio -0.508  < 2e-16   ***
#> 4     indus -0.484  < 2e-16   ***
#> 5       tax -0.469  < 2e-16   ***
#> 6       nox -0.427  < 2e-16   ***
#> 7      crim -0.388  < 2e-16   ***
#> 8       age -0.377  < 2e-16   ***
#> 9        zn   0.36  < 2e-16   ***
#> 10    black  0.333 1.32e-14   ***
#> 11      dis   0.25 1.21e-08   ***
summary(x)
#> Correlating medv with lstat rm ptratio indus tax nox crim age zn black dis. The median absolute correlation was 0.427 with a range from -0.738 to 0.695. 11 out of 11 variables where significant at the p <0.05 level
plot(x)
